text:
Barnard is a city in Lincoln County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 70 people lived there.
History.
Barnard was first settled in 1888. It was incorporated as a city in 1904. Barnard was named for J.F. Barnard, a railroad employee.
Geography.
Barnard is at (39.189213, -98.043078). Yhe United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Barnard has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Barnard has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 70 people, 43 households, and 16 families living in Barnard.
Education.
Barnard is part of USD 298 Lincoln.
Barnard schools were closed through school unification. The Barnard High School mascot was Cardinals.
